title: v3.0.0 | catch_stats.hpp| comparing floating-point with '==' or '!=' is unsafe [-Wfloat-equal]
body:
Hello

I have fetched Catch2 v3.0.0 with CMake:

```cmake
include(FetchContent)

FetchContent_Declare(
        Catch2
        GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2.git
        GIT_TAG v3.0.0-preview4
)

FetchContent_MakeAvailable(Catch2)
```

Then, it a file, I have `#include <catch2/catch_all.hpp>`.

Because my project uses gcc's flag `-Wfloat-equal`, I get the following warning:

```raw
D:/cmake-build-debug-system/_deps/catch2-src/src/catch2/benchmark/detail/catch_stats.hpp: In function 'Catch::Benchmark::Estimate<double> Catch::Benchmark::Detail::bootstrap(double, Iterator, Iterator, const sample&, Estimator&&)':
D:/cmake-build-debug-system/_deps/catch2-src/src/catch2/benchmark/detail/catch_stats.hpp:106:28: warning: comparing floating-point with '==' or '!=' is unsafe [-Wfloat-equal]
  106 |                 if (prob_n == 0) return { point, point, point, confidence_level };
      |                     ~~~~~~~^~~~
```

Here are the "faulty" lines in `catch_stats.hpp`:

```cpp
                int n = static_cast<int>(resample.size());
                double prob_n = std::count_if(resample.begin(), resample.end(), [point](double x) { return x < point; }) / static_cast<double>(n);
                // degenerate case with uniform samples
                if (prob_n == 0) return { point, point, point, confidence_level };
```

Best regards,
Pierre
